events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 28th, describing damage to the front bumper and left headlight.
After reviewing initial details, the claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' due to reported car damage following a minor collision.
An agent specialized in vehicle claims was assigned to the case to ensure prompt handling and proper investigation.
Acknowledgement of claim receipt was sent to the customer, confirming that the vehicle accident claim is now in process.
The insurer requested additional documentation including photos of vehicle damage, accident report, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents such as photos, police report, and repair shop assessment within the deadline.
The investigation team began review of the submitted files and reached out for statements from involved parties.
Investigation concluded confirming the claim is valid and there was no fault by the insured in the auto collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to the insured covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement for ten days.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process.
The claim was officially approved and all terms of the settlement were agreed upon by both the insurer and insured.
Insurance payment was issued covering the total amount for repairs and rental reimbursement as per the approved claim.
The claim file was closed after confirmation that repairs were completed satisfactorily and all payments were processed.
The claim documentation was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference involving the auto accident.
